channel.title: Android chat app
channel.description:
I have 1 week to make a chat app in android/java for my ICT course in high school. This stuff's for my finals and I refused to use any of those blocky development thingies so I have to do it all manually. Problem is that I have 0 experience with android app development.
The server itself shouldn't be much of a problem but the client/app... whenever I look stuff up about where to start it just seems like a clusterfuck of work to just set it up. Could anyone just please point out where to start the most straightforward way? That and maybe a resource on how to work with the UI and stuff..

item.title: Android chat app
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:2, topic:551528”]Android Studio is the most straightforward way to do it using Java. It’s based off of IntelliJ IDEA so unfortunately it’s pretty bloated, as every Java IDE is. You can also download Xamarin Studio to develop apps using C# (I think natively), and in all honesty, the GUI designer is probably way better. Android Studio’s designer and resource management system plain sucks. I’m not keen on using an XML file to design windows. Also you’ll have to double check, but Visual Studio 2015 - which is available now - allows mobile development. Visual Studio blows every other IDE out of the water so I’d recommend checking that out first.

I’ve developed a game using Android Studio for my Kindle Fire HD 6, which runs on Android, so I have a bit of experience.[/quote]

I primarily use Xamarin at work and I wouldn’t have it any other way. Plus, C# is lovely.

Read full topic

item.title: Android chat app
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

if you don’t want to use block dev tools but also don’t want to write code, then what exactly are you expecting to be able to do? it’s only ict dude, they wouldn’t care if u did it in word

item.title: Android chat app
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:3, topic:551528”]I’ll check Android Studio first and then Visual Studio. Better than having to download a plugin for Eclipse and not being able to get it to work

I have no experience with C# so that’s out of the question

Thanks, Lin
don’t think creating ui with xml will be that difficult[/quote]
You can download a version of eclipse with the plugins pre-installed, it’s really not that hard to use either.

Read full topic

item.title: Android chat app
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Android Studio is the most straightforward way to do it using Java. It’s based off of IntelliJ IDEA so unfortunately it’s pretty bloated, as every Java IDE is. You can also download Xamarin Studio to develop apps using C# (I think natively), and in all honesty, the GUI designer is probably way better. Android Studio’s designer and resource management system plain sucks. I’m not keen on using an XML file to design windows. Also you’ll have to double check, but Visual Studio 2015 - which is available now - allows mobile development. Visual Studio blows every other IDE out of the water so I’d recommend checking that out first.

I’ve developed a game using Android Studio for my Kindle Fire HD 6, which runs on Android, so I have a bit of experience.

Read full topic

The server itself shouldn’t be much of a problem but the client/app… whenever I look stuff up about where to start it just seems like a clusterfuck of work to just set it up. Could anyone just please point out where to start the most straightforward way? That and maybe a resource on how to work with the UI and stuff…
